intro: Solandra grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered solandra, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to yellow and orange. The plant produces fragrant blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Solandra grandiflora is typically found in moist, shaded environments and can grow up to several meters in height.
